6.24.18  2:08 am     When it comes to learning to play an instrument, a reason why people tend to seek teachers is because there are several barriers that teachers help to break down.
  For example, you usually need short, easier songs to start with, so you can work your way up to the harder, more interesting songs, but simple songs (real simple, like I'm talking straight infantile) are usually more boring, thus less popular, and thus harder to find. Teachers help with this because over time they acquire tons of dead easy songs, hard songs, and the whole gradient between.
  Also, teachers provide a shortcut to valuable knowledge, like "the more you do it, the better you get" or "start simple and work your way up" or "remember to take breaks".
  In short, teachers are like grocery stores. Sure, you could go farm-to-farm trying to get what you need, but it's much easier to go to one source that is experienced in getting you what you need.
  Rebuttal?
